title: Cory Morgan: Banning the Russian Pavilion at Edmonton Heritage Festival Reeks of Intolerance
description: The Edmonton Heritage Festival in August 2018. (The Epoch Times)

title: Dutch Government Collapses Over Immigration Policy
description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte speaks at a news conference with French President Emmanuel Macron (not pictured) in Amsterdam, Netherlands, on April 12, 2023. (Piroschka van de Wouw/Reuters, File Photo)

title: Russian Pavilion Will Not Be Included in Edmonton Heritage Festival: Organizers
description: A folklore dancing group from Russia performs during the International Folk Festival Is Pariglias 2012 in Assemini, Sardinia, Italy, on Aug. 1, 2012. (Angyalosi Beata/Shutterstock)

title: Group Files Application to International Court of Justice Against Iran Over Downing of Flight PS752
description: Photographs of victims of Flight PS752 are seen as thousands of people attend a rally to mark the National Day of Remembrance for Victims of Air Disasters, on the three year anniversary since the Iran military shot down the flight, in North Vancouver, B.C., on Jan. 8, 2023. (Darryl Dyck/The Canadian Press)

title: US Confirms Talks With Russia Over Prisoner Swap Involving WSJ Reporter
description: U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich, arrested on espionage charges, stands inside a defendants' cage before a hearing to consider an appeal on his extended detention at The Moscow City Court in Moscow, Russia, on June 22, 2023. (Natalia Kolesnikova/AFP via Getty Images)

title: France Passes Bill to Allow Police to ‘Secretly’ Activate Phone Cameras of Suspects
description: Police officers stand in front of a looted shop during clashes with police in Lyon, south-eastern France, on June 30, 2023, three days after a 17-year-old boy was shot in the chest by police at point-blank range in Nanterre, a western suburb of Paris. (Jeff Pachoud /AFP via Getty Images)

title: DNA Testing Leads to Former US Army Soldier in 1978 Killing of Woman in Germany
description: Murder suspect Tommy Molina in an undated mugshot. (Scotts Bluff County Detention Center via AP)

title: At Least 8 Dead After Apartment Building Crumbles in Brazil
description: Rescue workers look for victims among debris of a building collapse in Recife, Pernambuco state, Brazil, on July 7, 2023. (Anderson Stevens/Reuters)

title: ANALYSIS: Westerners Ponder Putin’s Power After Mutiny Attempt
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin chairs a meeting with members of the government via a video conference at the Kremlin in Moscow on July 4, 2023. (Alexander Kazakov / Sputnik / AFP)

title: Chinese Ambassador, Victoria Mayor Discuss Deepening of Sister-City Partnerships
description: China’s Ambassador to Canada Cong Peiwu is interviewed by journalists at the Chinese Embassy in Ottawa on Nov. 22, 2019. (The Canadian Press/Justin Tang)

title: Cory Morgan: Double Standard: Why Should Quebec Pay Less Carbon Tax Than Other Provinces?
description: A man replaces the nozzle after filling up at a gas station in Montreal in a file photo. (The Canadian Press/Paul Chiasson)

title: Djokovic Beats Wawrinka Just Before Closing Time
description: Serbia's Novak Djokovic celebrates winning his third round match against Switzerland's Stan Wawrinka during The Championships Wimbledon 2023 at All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club in London, Britain, on July 7, 2023. (Andrew Couldridge/Reuters)

title: US Eyes ASEAN Cooperation to Push Back Against China in Blinken’s Visit
description: A member of the Philippine coast guard vessel BRP Malabrigo manning his post while being shadowed by a Chinese coast guard ship at Second Thomas Shoal in the Spratly Islands in the disputed South China Sea, on April 23, 2023. (Ted Ajibe/AFP via Getty Images)

title: ‘Cluster Bombs’ Headed for Ukraine Pack a Punch, but Leave Lethal ‘Duds’ in Wake
description: Ukrainian army from the 43rd Heavy Artillery Brigade fire the German howitzer Panzerhaubitze 2000, called Tina by the unit, near Bahmut, in Donetsk region, Ukraine, on Feb. 5, 2023. (Marko Djurica/Reuters)

title: Robodebt Report Evidence Now in Hands of Crime Fighters
description: A copy of the Report of the Royal Commission into the Robodebt Scheme is seen at Parliament House in Canberra, July 7, 2023. (AAP Image/Lukas Coch)

title: Indian Authorities Arrests 3 Railway Officials Over the Train Crash That Killed More Than 290
description: Rescuers work at the site of passenger trains accident in Balasore district, eastern Indian state of Orissa, on June 3, 2023. (Arabinda Mahapatra/AP Photo)

title: A Gas Platform Explosion Off Mexico Injures 6 Workers and Leaves Several Missing, Officials Say
description: File photo of a police tape in Mexico. (Guillermo Arias/AFP via Getty Images)

title: 8-Year-Old Girl in ‘Life-Threatening Condition’ After Deadly School Car Crash in Wimbledon
description: Police officers set up cordon line as a car crashed into a primary school building in Wimbledon, London, on July 6, 2023. (Kin Cheung/AP Photo)

title: The Battle to Save Australia’s Ultra Rare Grumpy Fish
description: A supplied image obtained on October 2, 2019, shows a red handfish. The fish is believed to be the world's rarest with fewer than 100 left on the planet. (AAP Image/University of Tasmania, Rick Stuart-Smith)

title: Calgary Stampede a Celebration of Western Culture
description: Flag bearers start the Calgary Stampede parade in Calgary on July 7, 2023. (Jeff McIntosh/The Canadian Press)

title: Conservatives Say Parties Reach Agreement on Terms for Foreign Interference Inquiry
description: Minister of Intergovernmental Affairs, Infrastructure, and Communities Dominic LeBlanc rises during Question Period in the House of Commons on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on March 27, 2023. (Justin Tang/The Canadian Press)

title: Albanese Heads to Europe for Talks on Ukraine, Economy
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese at a press conference at Parliament House in Canberra, June 15, 2023. (AAP Image/Mick Tsikas)

title: Biden Faces Strong Opposition From His Own Party on Cluster Munitions
description: A Cluster Bomb Unit containing more than 600 cluster bombs, that was dropped by Israeli warplanes during the 34-day-long Hezbollah-Israeli war, sits in a field in the southern village of Ouazaiyeh, Lebanon, on Nov. 9, 2006. (Mohammed Zaatari/AP Photo)

title: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy Visits Istanbul for Talks With Turkish President
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky speaks during a press conference in the western Ukrainian city of Lviv, on Jan. 11, 2023. (Yuriy Dyachyshyn/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Australian Slave Keeper Jail Time Increased for Contacting Victim
description: A general view of the County Court of Victoria in Melbourne, April 3, 2023. (AAP Image/Joel Carrett)

title: Australian Wildlife Hospital Staff Devastated as Funding Scrapped
description: A supplied image obtained on July 7, 2023, of vets treating injured animals at the Byron Bay Wildlife Hospital. (AAP Image/Supplied by Byron Bay Wildlife Hospital)
